pr_body: This PR adds a `.gitgnore` file that hides the `target` directory and `Cargo.lock` from git.

pr_title: Convert repository to a cargo workspace
pr_body:
Resolves #44.

## Describe your changes:
* Moved `src/block/` to `crates/devices/virtio-blk` crate
* Moved `src/device` to `crates/virtio-device` crate
* Moved `src/queue.rs` to `crates/virtio-queue` crate

```
vm-virtio
+- crates
|   +- virtio-queue
|   +- virtio-device
|   +- devices
|   |   +- virtio-blk
|   |   +- virtio-net
```

I chose `crates` over `src` as it better suggests that the repository is organized as a workspace, but I can switch back to /src or a different name (virtio maybe?). 

Also which ones would you prefer?
`virtio-blk`, `virtio-queue`, etc or `vm-block`, `vm-queue`, etc
`devices/virtio-blk` or `device-types/virtio-blk`

## Help wanted:
At the moment, the only problem comes from the code that does some mocking in [queue.rs](https://github.com/rust-vmm/vm-virtio/blob/f63b67d90188186d116dba739c5db05916db296e/src/queue.rs#L721-L950) and is also imported in the [block device tests](https://github.com/rust-vmm/vm-virtio/blob/f63b67d90188186d116dba739c5db05916db296e/src/block/request.rs#L253). Block device tests aren't able to use `Descriptor::new()` because it was implemented inside the `#[cfg(tests)] pub mod tests` of a different crate (virtio-queue). I've looked into moving the mocking code into a different crate as suggested by @andreeaflorescu, but I got stuck when I couldn't implement `Descriptor` outside the crate where it was defined. My suggestion is to move the mocking code outside the tests module, until we come up with a better solution.

pr_body:
The vm-virtio paths need to be updated after vm-virtio was split into
several crates [here](https://github.com/rust-vmm/vm-virtio/pull/58)  .

pr_title: Move virtio-queue constant definitions to a dedicated module
pr_body:
This is similar to virtio-blk, which already has a dedicated constant definitions module.
My only question is whether to make some of the constants `pub(crate)`, more specifically the ones that define sizes (VIRTQ_AVAIL_ELEMENT_SIZE, etc), as they are only used in virtio-queue crate at the moment.
pr_review_comments: [{'comment_id': 678113217, 'comment_body': 'Please add the copyright.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2021, 7, 28, 9, 0, 53, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'lauralt', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 678157462, 'comment_body': '2021?', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2021, 7, 28, 10, 1, 31, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'andreeaflorescu', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 678162438, 'comment_body': 'Done!', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2021, 7, 28, 10, 8, 53, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'krady21', 'type': 'User'}]

pr_body:
Closes #72.
This PR tries to merge the two interfaces that are used for mocking the driver side of virtio queue operations: the one used for unit tests and the one used for benchmarks.
pr_review_comments: [{'comment_id': 685399431, 'comment_body': 'This sub module should be conditionally enabled for test only.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2021, 8, 9, 17, 48, 22, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'jiangliu', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 685827818, 'comment_body': "I wanted to add just a few more changes to `MockSplitQueue`. After that I'll squash some of the commits, add some documentation and I'll leave the module behind a dev-dependency enabled feature, as suggested. ", 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2021, 8, 10, 8, 56, 36, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'krady21', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 686500788, 'comment_body': 'Would be nice to add a better description here.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2021, 8, 11, 5, 25, 13, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'alexandruag', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 686501889, 'comment_body': "We can delete the commented stuff if we don't end up using it later. In particular, the index operator seems like it could have been nice here as a more concise way of calling `ref_at`. Is the commented implementation not working? ", 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2021, 8, 11, 5, 28, 14, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'alexandruag', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 686502641, 'comment_body': "Is this commented out because the new module has public objects, methods, etc. which don't have doc comments?", 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2021, 8, 11, 5, 29, 52, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'alexandruag', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 686505199, 'comment_body': 'Yeah it looks like some of the commits can (and should :D) be squashed. Also, I think we don\'t need to leave the module as a dev-dependency enabled feature really; we can have a feature that enables the module for external consumers, and then conditionally compile it with something `like #[cfg(any(test, feature="feature_name"))]` (haven\'t actually validated that\'s the correct syntax). That way, it\'s enabled for external consumers when the feature is selected, and when tests run within the local crate.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2021, 8, 11, 5, 36, 37, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'alexandruag', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 686517957, 'comment_body': "Hmm, wondering whether we should use accessors (i.e.` vq.desc_table()`) instead of pub members, and also whether things are more straight forward if we add more helpers (i.e. something like the indexing operator for `DescriptorTable` for easier access to individual descriptors). Let's have a quick chat about this.", 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2021, 8, 11, 5, 51, 44, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'alexandruag', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 686519809, 'comment_body': 'Is this macro still used anywhere?', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2021, 8, 11, 5, 53, 33, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'alexandruag', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 686520568, 'comment_body': 'Hmm, maybe it would be nicer and more convenient to have `new` always assume `GuestAddress(0)` as the start address, and have a separate constructor that allows us to specify a custom value.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2021, 8, 11, 5, 55, 26, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'alexandruag', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 686588929, 'comment_body': 'It is used in the first [test](https://github.com/rust-vmm/vm-virtio/blob/5f803bfec099b9ae999cfabc725d7641ceb503e0/crates/virtio-queue/src/lib.rs#L970-L975) and I could not find a good replacement for it.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2021, 8, 11, 7, 55, 3, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'krady21', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 688335314, 'comment_body': 'This should only be enabled for tests and when the `test-utils` feature is used.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2021, 8, 13, 8, 22, 8, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'andreeaflorescu', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 688335819, 'comment_body': "It is a best practice to only import what you're using from the module. Right now you might be using everything from it, but as we add functionality to `mock` that will not be the case anymore. This is why it's better to be explicit in your imports.", 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2021, 8, 13, 8, 23, 1, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'andreeaflorescu', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 688699277, 'comment_body': 'Done. Thank you for the advice.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2021, 8, 13, 18, 17, 10, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'krady21', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 689057299, 'comment_body': 'Done.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2021, 8, 15, 9, 5, 57, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'krady21', 'type': 'User'}]
